detaileddescription.para: use a LUT, don't include norms (OK for IP or normalized vectors)
compute the norms from the look-up tables (cost is in O(M^2))

briefdescription.para: use a LUT, and store float32 norm with the vectors
use a LUT, and store 8bit-quantized norm
use a LUT, and store non-uniform quantized norm

detaileddescription.para: use a 2x4 bits lsq as norm quantizer (for fast scan)

briefdescription.para: use a 2x4 bits rq as norm quantizer (for fast scan)
Encodes how search is performed and how vectors are encoded.
Binary or of the Train_* flags below.
number of iterations for codebook refinement.
beam size used for training and for encoding

detaileddescription.para: Currently used mode of approximate min-k computations. Default value is EXACT_TOPK.

briefdescription.para: if non-NULL, use this index for assignment

detaileddescription.para: codebook #1 is stored in rows codebook_offsets[i]:codebook_offsets[i+1] in the codebooks table of size total_codebook_size by d

briefdescription.para: size of the codebook in vectors

detaileddescription.para: auxiliary data for ST_norm_lsq2x4 and ST_norm_rq2x4 store norms of codebook entries for 4-bit fastscan

briefdescription.para: norms of all codebook entries (size total_codebook_size)

detaileddescription.para: dot products of all codebook entries with the previous codebooks size sum(codebook_offsets[m] * 2^nbits[m], m=0..M-1)
norms and distance matrixes with beam search can get large, so use this to control for the amount of memory that can be allocated

briefdescription.para: Also determines what's in the codes.
do a few iterations of codebook refinement after first level estimation

detaileddescription.para: set this bit on train_type if beam is to be trained only on the first element of the beam (faster but less accurate)
set this bit to not autmatically compute the codebook tables after training

detaileddescription.para: Exact L2 search, with precomputed norms
Residual quantizer with variable number of bits per sub-quantizer
The residual centroids are stored in a big cumulative centroid table. The codes are represented either as a non-compact table of size (n, M) or as the compact output (n, code_size).
